intro: Heterodendrum microcalyx, commonly known as the small-fruited heterodendrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its vine-like growth habit and distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and thrives in warm, humid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
